name: Dana Andrews
text: The employee at the office was very disinterested in her job and/or being helpful. She was even this way when I called before my arrival with questions. However, the drivers and employees at Fairview station are WONDERFUL!! I am a first time bus rider. I purchase a monthly pass because it is cheaper than filling up my tank.

name: Smokey Watts
text: Beware of the bathrooms in between daily cleaning. You never know what you mifht run into.

name: Patrick Mangum
text: yes some confusion at first but both of dispatcher and the drivers were very understanding very polite very professional and I did get home a little late a little wet but I did get home so yes they are to be commended

name: Rochelle Matlock-Charlie
text: It was clean, they have attended keeping it nice she was friendly and courteous. There was also an "M" Supervisor present letting us know what bus was coming in and what direction the buses were traveling. The two drivers I rode with were friendly, professional and seemed very knowledgeable in their respective fields. I appreciate having this service, please keep it going and growing.

name: Melissa Jennings (Lissa)
text: Always a blast to travel where I need to with almost every person on the planet. They keep it safe, efficient & quick

name: L J Dude
text: Some of bus drivers are good but the majority of them are rude and very disrespectful. Maybe they're having a bad day but they should be more professional. Certain drivers must be related to city officials to be working there.

name: Anita Knighton
text: I can most of the time get where I need to be in a good amount of time.

name: Mikesha Wilson
text: They really need a Sunday service , more professional drivers, and leave on time as scheduled on the bus pamphlets..

name: Robert Nobles
text: Love riding the bus.

name: Kieon Coleman
text: I wish the bus ran 24/7 so I could catch it to and from work...but I can only take it to work, because I get off at 10:30pm, and the buses stop at 9. :(

name: Cathy Hill
text: It needs a place to shelter from rain and to sit for elderly. Also needs to be on time.

name: Valarie Conrad
text: My husband works here. Lol

name: Deborah Braswell
text: Don't accept credit cards and don't have day passes.

name: Jeannette Ajaz
text: Well it doesn't help people to attend church services on a Sunday!

name: Pierre Howard
text: Bus drivers are sometimes inconsiderate

name: Oscar Webster
text: Excellent

name: michael mc gill
text:
#12 driver
Red

name: Queen Kay
text: The buses is to slow

name: Kevin Tran
text: This Address point to Loves Gas Station.. but the bus never stop to this place.. you guy need to update address..!!

name: Angela Lymon
text: It's NO bus station they put u off at a gas station EVERGREEN is sad how do ppl live n this place it's not even a town....

name: Denise Taylor
text: Never road on a bus, but know the owners in evergreen. You shouldn't have a problem unless you cause one. Very friendly

name: Don Den
text: So small...did not know i past it

name: Thomas Smith
text: Not there

name: Michele Archer
text: All they have is a derelict building which you can't even sit it out if the elements.

name: TODD SIMPSON
text: If u need a ride

name: Andrew Clark
text: Wash your hands

name: Guy Miller
text: Not alot of options to choose from when pertaining to food, need more wall chargers but the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They are the only reason i am leaving 3 stars.

name: Simmone
text: This is not for any specific location. Just greyhound customer service and their refund system.My bus from Atmore, Al to Houston, Tx was cancelled on the 5th and I was not informed. I waited at the pick up location for almost 3 hours while being on hold for half of that time. I paid $150 for this ticket. My refund was eventually processed on the 7th after having to call again after the ticket end day. But its now the day before Thanksgiving and i still dont have my refund. These are the holidays and I could use all my money. 7 -14 business days is blasphemy. Its day 12 and thanksgiving is tomorrow. I shouldn't have to wait on my money for an error the company made. Although the actually bus rides are fine...the process of getting your money back is impossible and I hope this is corrected soon because money doesn't grow on trees and I need mine.

name: Lisa Bell
text: Bus did not show up. I was very disappointed.

name: Jason “jaybird” Holmes
text: Greyhound bus stop r gas station's that r closed in dangerous area's

name: Angela R.
text: Not good

name: Elizabeth Tolbert
text: Missed bus.we didn't know u have to yell for them.sge drove right by.was lucky to get ride to terminal.

name: Debbie Troullier
text: If I could give it no stars I would, my son got on the bus in Wisconsin and had a lay over in Chicago where he fell asleep and missed his bus. They would reroute him on another bus for $20 cash (only cash) but he had no cash and I couldn't pay the $20 over the phone so I had to pay for another ticket on line just to get him home. I WILL NOT EVER USE GREYHOUND AGAIN. Total RIP offs for the way they do and you go through the act of Congress to talk to the actually bus station and not international people. Very very disappointed.

name: Amber Townsend
text: I bought a ticket online. Before I purchased this ticket I called and asked what I needed to do first because it’s for a minor. They told me buy the ticket in your name. I did this. They are now telling me he can’t pick the ticket up nor can I get a refund. What a crappy thing to do to people.

name: Zack
text: The driver that stops at Popeyes on 157 is the best

name: Emilio Valdez
text: Nice and clean place. I was next door waiting for this place to open. I called to make sure I don't lug 100 lbs to find out its not open and freeze outside but nobody picks up the phone. I make my way over because I saw movement inside the station. The lady was a little rude and as I wait for my bus the phone rings and she will not answer it. Sucks for the person trying to make arrangements.

name: Kevin Rosado
text: Unfortunately there is no choice for very poor-extremely poor.  Gray hound oversells tickets and then tell some passanger that they do not have room in the bus for them at the point of boarding the bus.  I was sold a ticket for $ 190.50. At the time the bus came in I was told by the driver that the bus was full and there was not room for me. I showed him my ticket and he said that did not mean anything because everyone who as in the bus also had a ticket and there is not room for me. From the beginning the ticket agen was a very rude woman and the bus driver was very rude as well. I was not given a chance to board the bus and then I was told that my ticket was non-refundable. If I wanted a refundable ticket I should have bought it for $ 25.00 more dollars at the time I bourght my ticket.  Even though it was not my fault and I was there to get aboard and was refused an entrance to the bus they did not want to return my money.  THIS IS BLUNT THIEVERY. BE WARE. This was happed to many people I have talked to about this incident. GO TO ANOTHER LINE OF BUSES AND DON'T GET CHEATED!!!

name: Fukin Flip
text: Not happy with grey hound!!!they screwed me outta money ,sold me the wrong ticket and caused me to get home too late to see my grandfather before he died.keep the money it was worth it to see how bad your business really is!!!

name: betti webb
text: Have not been here

name: Love Moonflower
text: Simple and sweet. Inside a store. Works same as any station here.  Can't get a taxi around here tho.  Ubers are rare also

name: Bernard Robinson
text: Because you used to have to go to Opelika to catch the bus

name: Jim Francis
text: Small town stop.  Quick breakfast foods and cheap cigarettes here.

name: Randy Wiggins
text: Can't say much didn't stay long just stopped for pick up

name: shawn Cripe
text: 💘 it
